articles.description: New imaging technology has allowed geologists to see the bare earth, and its potential red flags, around Yellowstone like never before.
articles.content:
Revealing new data has pulled back the curtain on a network of "geological hazards" sitting beneath a portion of Yellowstone National Park, according to scientists studying the land in that region.

articles.title: What Was The Lifespan Of A Dinosaur? - IFLScience
articles.description: Before an asteroid brought the dino party to a swift end 66 million years ago, they were the rockstars of ancient Earth.
articles.content:
This article first appeared in Issue 14 of our free digital magazine CURIOUS.
